publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1722 Mr Brian Monteith: Effect of Pensions Tax on Stirling Council—That the Parliament acknowledges that the decision in July 1997 by Her Majesty's Government to abolish advance corporation tax relief on pension funds has cost Stirling Council £2,300,000 over the past four years, equivalent to £74 for every Band D council taxpayer; and notes that the cost to the council in the current financial year is £260,000, at a time when the council’s administration has announced spending cuts to frontline services, including voluntary bodies and a cut of £250,000 from the budgets of local schools, together with a 17% rise in council tax over the next three years.
